sub_title: Project Manager MENA Region at Delphy International
summary:
As a sustainability-oriented, responsible, and committed person, I have a passion to strive for sustainable development across the globe. This passion started during my B.Sc degree in Water Engineering and carried me to complete my M.Sc. degree in Sustainable Management- Water and Energy. Throughout my studies, I have improved my knowledge and skills in the topics of water, energy, environmental engineering, climate change and agriculture. I have also participated in different funded exchange programmes and internships in Egypt, Germany, Italy, and the Netherlands.

Living in 4 countries in the past few years, taught me many life lessons. I learned to appreciate the diversity of all people from different cultures and backgrounds and to develop my ability to communicate across language and culture barriers. Besides, I realized the benefits of learning from others. 

Currently, I am working as a project manager in the North & West Africa team at the agricultural consultancy and knowledge company, Delphy. In the meantime, I am a part-time PhD student at RWTH Aachen. Through my positions, I aim to combine methods with a practical understanding of agriculture and scientific research.

Feel free to check out my background and connect!

The dean's list is a list of the best students from each course of study at RWTH Aachen University.", 'image': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E2DAQEPd8tX9i01gg/profile-treasury-image-shrink_8192_8192/0/1619941182098?e=1692946800&v=beta&t=bLSucLjf7YU57rV4mLC6UeDEI47ITulXVmuxJ5rBbyw'}, {'url': None, 'title': "Master's thesis: System dynamics modeling of the water, energy and agriculture nexus in Egypt", 'description': "The current research introduces a system dynamics (SD) modeling of the interconnections between water, energy, and agriculture to examine the food security status in Egypt and improve water and energy resources management in agricultural production. The WEF model presented in this study simulates the nexus of the dynamics of Egypt's consumption and production of agricultural products, and the water and energy use for agricultural production and their compounding effects on Egypt's food gap.", 'image': None}]
